title: Task 12

question.text: Choose the sentence that uses many and much correctly.

answers.answer: I don't have much time to finish the project.
She has many water in her glass.
answers.feedback: Water is an uncountable noun, so you should use much instead of many to describe the quantity.

answers.answer: Can you give me many advice on this topic?
answers.feedback: Advice is an uncountable noun, so it's correct to say much advice instead of many advice.

answers.answer: There is much people at the concert.
answers.feedback: People is a countable noun when referring to individuals, so you should use many instead of much

description:
Many and much are used to talk about quantities, but they are used with different types of nouns. Many is used with countable nouns, which are things you can count, like apples, cars, or books. For example, you can say There are many books on the shelf.

Much is used with uncountable nouns, which are things you cannot count individually, like water, sand, or information. For example, you might say There is not much water left in the bottle.
